summary: air pollutants included particulate matters smaller than 10 m, and 2.5 m (PM10, PM2.5), carbon monoxide (CO), nitrogen dioxide (NO2), ozone (O3) and sulphur dioxide (SO2) the studied outcomes were non-accidental and cardiovascular mortality. single-day lag models were studied and adjusted for confounders. single-day lag two-pollutant models for association between PM10 and mortality. Table S2b. Single-day lag two-pollutant models for association between O3 and mortality.
